short_summary: Stage 2 - Dixon Bridge Replacement, Grasslands National Park, construction service of bridge
description: replace the existing bridge over the Frenchman River with a new bridge & site restoration.
full_summary:
# Stage 2: Dixon Bridge Replacement, Grasslands National Park

**Reference Number:** CB-5094-26186938
**Amendment Number:** 1
**Solicitation Number:** 5P468-23-0028/A

**Tender Closing Date:** May 18, 2023, 4:00 PM (Local Time)
**Publication Date:** April 27, 2023

Parks Canada invites qualified contractors to submit a financial bid for the replacement of the Dixon Bridge over the Frenchman River in Grasslands National Park, Saskatchewan. 

## Project Overview

This project involves the design, construction, maintenance, and dismantling of a temporary detour path, including a temporary steel-clad bridge, demolition and ecological removal of the existing wooden bridge, construction of a new small span concrete and steel bridge, and associated roadworks, including grading and restoration of the site.

The site is located within the Critical Habitat for the Sage Grouse, and the project is subject to the Environment and Energy Policy. This is a two-stage selection process, with the first stage evaluating the qualifications of all interested suppliers, and the second stage inviting qualified suppliers to submit a financial bid.

## Tender Process

The tender process is competitive, and the selection criteria are based solely on the lowest price. Interested suppliers are invited to submit their bid in accordance with the specifications and drawings provided.

## Contracting Entity

Parks Canada is the contracting entity for this project, and the solicitation adheres to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement. The contract will be executed under the terms and conditions specified in the solicitation document.

## Contact Information

For more information, please contact:
Kenneth Lacanilao, Contracting Authority
Email: [kenneth.lacanilao@pc.gc.ca](mailto:kenneth.lacanilao@pc.gc.ca)
Phone: (587) 832-1894

Note: The contact information provided is for general inquiries only. Only qualified suppliers have been invited to submit a bid, and all other interested parties are not eligible to participate in this tender.  Please refer to the solicitation document for detailed specifications and requirements.
